channel.title: Some 'virtual' Astronomy
channel.description: With some 'virtual' views at the telescope .. scroll down and click through the year .. to see astronomical observations made during the covid lockdowns of 2020 .. from plane-free night skies, to a naked-eye comet .. through to a wonderful display of planets and ending with ... ... the Great Jupiter-Saturn conjunction!

item.title: 11th April .. startrails around the pole star
item.description: 11th April and startrails around the pole star. Plane-free skies means no vapour trails to spoil the image. about 1 hours worth of 13s stacked exposures, 28mm lens, f/4, iso 800
item.media:description: 11th April and startrails around the pole star. Plane-free skies means no vapour trails to spoil the image. about 1 hours worth of 13s stacked exposures, 28mm lens, f/4, iso 800

item.title: VIDEO: 22nd May .. Mercury and Venus
item.description: 22nd May and Mercury and Venus close together in the evening sky. Mobile phone clip through 25mm eyepiece on Skywatcher Evostar 90 telescope
item.media:description: 22nd May and Mercury and Venus close together in the evening sky. Mobile phone clip through 25mm eyepiece on Skywatcher Evostar 90 telescope

item.title: VIDEO: 30th May .. a First Quarter Moon .. and a blackbird!
item.description: 30th May and a First Quarter Moon with a blackbird singing along. Mobile phone clip through 25mm eyepiece on a Skywatcher Evostar 90 telescope.
item.media:description: 30th May and a First Quarter Moon with a blackbird singing along. Mobile phone clip through 25mm eyepiece on a Skywatcher Evostar 90 telescope.

item.title: VIDEO: 12th July .. Saturn
